meanings.definition: Acceptance of what happens without active response or resistance.
meanings.sent1: Her passivity in the face of criticism surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The passivity of the audience during the lecture was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: His passivity towards chores led to a messy room.
meanings.sent4: The passivity of the lake mirrored her calm demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The passivity of the plants under the scorching sun was evident.

meanings.definition: The state of being inactive or not participating in an activity.
meanings.sent1: The passivity of the cat lying in the sun was adorable.
meanings.sent2: His passivity in sports made him a great spectator.
meanings.sent3: The passivity of the clock was a sign that it needed winding.
meanings.sent4: The passivity of the old car in the garage was a reminder of its age.
meanings.sent5: The passivity of the clouds signaled a calm day ahead.

meanings.definition: The quality of being submissive or easily influenced by others.
meanings.sent1: Her passivity in relationships often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The passivity of the employee made it hard for him to stand up for himself.
meanings.sent3: The passivity of the puppy made training a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The passivity of the student allowed the teacher to guide them easily.
meanings.sent5: The passivity of the wind chime made it sway gently in the breeze.
